intro: Schizoglossum stenoglossum subsp. stenoglossum, commonly known as the narrow-lipped schizoglossum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pale blue or white, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. The subspecies stenoglossum is distinguished by its narrow, tubular corolla and is often found in coastal or mountainous habitats.
